Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my sd600 (which I love) I needed more pixels and more glass and I got both.The 12x zoom, while a bit twitchy zooming, is a wonderful thing. Now I can take the SX200 with me on motorcycle trips and leave my 30# bag of big Canon SLR's and lenses at the studio. It's quick to fire up but slow on the draw, ie, there is the inevitable shutter lag. The big screen is bright and clear, the HDMI video is crystal clear. (would like to be able to zoom during video recording) The super macro is incredible. I can put the end of the lens right ON the subject and the shot is clean and clear. Got an 8Gb card and a spare battery. (battery life is less than I'd like) Flash is weak but red-eye isn't a problem. biggest negative I've got is that I cannot shoot in RAW mode as I have gotten used to its flexibility. All in all, a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo22GSCZRLF999G', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo22GSCZRLF999GloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; Great Price.

Reviews.Title: Several years later, still amazing
Reviews.Author: Escella
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a Best Buy maybe 3-4 years ago, and I've come back for another one, because mine was stolen at summer camp.I never had the lens error everyone is complaining about.I dropped it out of my second story window while trying to take pictures of the rain, it tumbled down the roof and into mud. After I cleaned it off and got all the junk out of it, aside from a few scratches, worked flawlessly.I'd never even heard of the lens thing until now... Hopefully my replacement wont have that problem because I love this camera. I bought a newer canon powershot and the battery was crap. My old one never died. I could take pictures every day, and videos, on a week long vacation and never have to charge it!Buy this camera. It does amazing things and takes amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Price
Reviews.Author: Neil S. Swain
Reviews.Content: I believe I caught this camera as the model was being discontinued, and I couldn't be happier. The price was fantastic and the only design flaw I don't care for is the spring loaded flash that pops up goes easily unnoticed before you turn the camera on. Just from the natural way of holding the camera, the flash can be held down by your fingers and cannot deploy. A small issue when you see the quality of pictures, especially in low light settings.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: jessmith
Reviews.Content: Like SO many others, this camera was great while it was working, but then one day the battery died while the lens was open and that's when we too were inflicted with the notorious 'Lens Error- Restart Camera' issue. We've only had the camera for 2 years and during that time we've treated it very well. 2 years might be a long time for a cheap camera to work, but this is a nearly $400 Canon camera so we expected to get more time out of it. This is clearly a manufactures issue and it's incredibly upsetting that a company as well-known as Canon would produce, sell and then refuse to take responsibility for an issue that is clearly affecting so many of their customers.  If we'd gone the cheap route then maybe this would be something we'd expect, but this camera was NOT cheap. We won't be buying Canon products again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Complete agreement with Ms. Jacqueline Buemi of April 3, 2009
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: There is nothing I can add to Ms. Buemi's review, other than that I am a professional photographer and have sold images taken with the SX200.  It is the perfect pocket/dashboard camera - small, excellent quality in all areas, and easy to operate on a moment's notice.  One of her most valid points is:  READ THE MANUAL!  If you do this and apply the knowledge to your use of the camera, you will agree that Canon has done it again!

Reviews.Title: Good High Quality Point and Click
Reviews.Author: Craig W.
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera that I have ever purchased on my own, and the first digital one at that. That being said I carry this pretty much wherever I go just in case I find myself needing it. The design of this is amazing, from how compact it is to the shape of the the hand grip it all feels so comfortable. It's shaped in such a way that even one handed shots are easy and come out clear. The fact that it has 12x zoom makes it so much better, for the price you could not find a more equipped camera in this size range. With all of the various photo options from landscape to pets and kids there really is no function that this could not fulfill. Now the flash is hidden in a compartment that flips up when the camera is turned on and sometimes my finger gets in the way, but its hard not to notice when it's trying to pop up. It can also appear to be noisy when starting up, but I can't imagine any more so than another camera with a retractable zoom.  All in all this is a great camera for someone like myself who is new to the photography scene and just want to have something simple, but I'm sure even those who have had a camera before would love it as well.

Reviews.Title: Great - as long as it's working...
Reviews.Author: Katydid215
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my father for Christmas, and we were all so impressed with it! It's probably been the best camera I've owned...that is until it quit working out of the blue one day. Yes...the infamous Canon lens error. I tried all the tricks I could find online to fix it myself, but to no avail. I broke down and called a local camera shop who chuckled when I told them the issue. They said they'd have to send it to Canon - apparently Canon doesn't authorize anyone to work on their cameras - and that the repair cost starts at $150 and goes up depending on Canon's determination of 'fault.' Basically, they'd send the camera to Canon for repair for $150, but I could walk away with a significantly higher cost at Canon's discression. The Camera shop recommended I just purchase a new camera. They were clearly unimpressed with this issue, which they were quite familiar with. I felt so bad because my father felt terrible, like he had purchased me a 'dud.'I should mention that this is the second Canon camera I've had that's quit working for no apparent reason. I will be switching brands until I hear that Canon has improved their quality and customer service. Too bad because their cameras are fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy
Reviews.Author: Meribell
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the bells and whistles, but it's heavy and not as compact as some of the others on the market. but the picture quality and zoom is amazing!  Overall I wouldn't trade it for any other camera.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I hoped for
Reviews.Author: Rick Stubbs
Reviews.Content: Everything about this camera has been exactly as advertised, and I have had it for over a year.  Great pictures, great zoom, nice portability, and Canon quality.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Olympia
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera - small enough to take everywhere, great optical zoom (12x), great image quality, and manual overrides for great control.We own two of these - my husband uses the automatic settings most of the time, but finds it easy enough to try other settings & modes.  We hike a lot, and find that the battery lasts several days, even when we are shooting pictures all day long.  The still image quality is outstanding; have not used the hd video so can't speak to that.  Would recommend this camera to anyone who wants high-quality images without lugging along a bulkier SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: hannahmorgannah
Reviews.Content: Easy to use camera.  This baby takes great pics.  The only flaw, I think, is the flash.  It is always active when taking pictures.  I cover it with my finger when I think a flash is unnecessary.  Other than that, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect!
Reviews.Author: justforfun
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is so close to being exactly what I wanted at a great price.  I wanted a wide angle/big zoom camera with adjustable controls for going beyond snapshot taking that is portable, affordable and takes great pictures.Pros:  It takes GREAT picture!  (Lots of positive comments from people who didn't know I changed cameras.)  The lens combination is what I like best.  The zoom allows me to take candid pictures of friends and family without being intrusive.  (Still visible, but not in their face.)  Landscapes actually turn out and catch the essence of the beauty.  Combined with the image stabilizer my photos have improved enormously!!  I've used the macro and super macro lenses for flowers in my yard.  They work wonderfully.  I love that it has a wide angle lens and the 12 mega pixels is not the overkill that I thought it would be.The settings aren't all just gimmicks.  I really can control what a picture will look like.  Color, light, depth of field can all be adjusted without having to remember aperture and shutter speed settings, but you CAN use them if you're fluent in them.The image stabilizer works!!The video wasn't a consideration for me and I've barely used it, but it IS HD and looks amazing!  The sound is pretty good too.In over a thousand pictures since I got the camera, I've only had two pictures with any red eye at all.  Most pictures have been outdoors, but even so, the pop up flash (which hasn't bothered me) works great.As others have said, read and then reread the manual once you're more familiar with the camera.  There are so many features, it's hard to remember them all.Cons:  I MISS the optical view finder!  The camera has some warning icons built in to warn you about possible closed eyes and camera movement which helps in bright sunlight.All flash options are not available on all camera settings.  It is annoying to take a picture, look at it, realize it would be better with a fill in flash and have to change the setting in order to find the flash option.There is a bit of a learning curve to realize its potential, but that's also part of the fun!I gave it a 5, because I really love the camera and it seems to be an excellent buy!

Reviews.Title: Perfect combo of size and features!
Reviews.Author: jlrichar1
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Great battery life!  Amazing features!For anyone who is tentative about this camera b/c other reviewers claim that the features are lacking...put your reservations aside!  I will say that the manual is a bit lacking--it does mention all of the features but it definitely doesn't explain how to use them or the extent of their use as well as it could.  So, you will need to devote some time to playing with the camera and the manual to figure out exactly what the camera can do and how to do it.I will say that this is not a point and shoot camera...I mean, it does point and shoot exceptionally well!  However, the artistic features of this camera is what really makes it spectacular!  Sepia, B&W;, single color, enhanced color, contrast, manual settings, etc.Anyway, great camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice cam, nothing to complain about
Reviews.Author: Jim Verstale
Reviews.Content: I own this cam for about 2 months, so far, and I love it. It is real japan made, strong and nice. The image quality exceeds my expectations from a little cam and the awesome lens lets me shoot from tele to wide and macro. I am very happy with it. Oh yeh the vide is superb too!

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great manual features
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Everything to love about this camera. Only had it a month so durability is still unknown. Already made it through a backpacking trip and some family events. Small enough for my pockets, but I'm a big guy with big pockets.If you are looking to do manual adjustments and create your own style then this camera will work for you.Plus the zoom is great, easy to control and digital zoom can be turned off witch is great.Wish there was a traditional view finder, but those are hard to find today.Great camera, Cannon is easy to understand and well made.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Donna McFarland "Bead to be happy"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality, ease of using, and size.  Not too big, not too small.

Reviews.Title: The best upgrade for me!
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this purchase of this camera! It is a major upgrade for me from a 3MP camera with a lousy macro function and no manual controls. I absolutely love the manual controls, in fact all the pictures I have taken of since I got it has been on the manual function. The images are wonderful, and can be made even better with a little bit of touch up on Photoshop (brighter, tone, and sharpen). I really enjoy the camera's super macro function, it really makes a huge difference than my previous camera which only made close things a little sharper. I would really recommend it and reiterate my happiness with this awesome camera! Wonderful! Especially if you want to learn and play with the manual function, you can not go wrong with the Canon Powershot SX200IS!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Mazmnanian "photography lover"
Reviews.Content: Canon never disappoints me. If you want to get a nice digital camera this is one of the best, if not the best, from the Power-shot series. Battery life is pretty good, the image quality looks great. If you know how to set it up to the Manual setting correctly, the images look like professional pictures. Since, I haven't played with it yet, (one of my photographer friends put the settings on the Manual), I go with Auto, which automatically chooses the best setting for the picture. Very good camera and convenient to carry for traveling. I had two other Canons before, without any problems. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: wonderful advanced amateur cam!
Reviews.Author: daKine34
Reviews.Content: this camera takes amazing pics, the super zoom is wonderful and crystal clear, the numerous functions/settings make picture taking even more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Harms
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic.  I wish it were a little smaller.  Other than that, perfect!

Reviews.Title: Nice high quality easy to use, with excellent photo quality
Reviews.Author: Mark Nickelson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for her trip to Peru.  She broke the last point-and-shoot I bought her and I'm actually glad she did!  This camera takes fantastic photos, and I do mean fantastic!  I told my wife she needed to review the manual with this one and really learn how to use her camera so she could get the most out of it.  I'm not sure she really needed to because the easy function is really, well, easy.  The vividness of the colors in the shots was simply outstanding.The zoom was one of the main reasons I chose this camera because I knew she would be in the mountains and be taking a lot of scenery shots.  With 12MP you can crop quite a bit but the zoom did come in handy.The only cons I can think of is the night shot settings.  I think the easy button doesn't quite cut it there, but with manual settings I'm sure it will work just fine.  Also, the first shot speed is a bit lagged (confirming what was reported in Consumer Reports).All in all I'm very happy with this product and would recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced compact camera with a short learning curve.  (when I saw all of the photos she took I had to ask her when she became such good photographer!)

Reviews.Title: The BEST.
Reviews.Author: Hyungbum Pyun "Ben K"
Reviews.Content: IF YOU LOOKING FOR THE CAMERA TO USEING FOR pic some picture in home or outside sometimes, CHOOSE THIS CAMERA.This is what you looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Nance "smile giver"
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera that had more versatility than our little Canon elph but didn't want the bulk of an SLR.  This is a great camera.  The images are very good but it is the ability to utilize a 12x optical zoom in a very portable size that makes this camera.  Am enjoying it very much.  Hard to beat a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Rush's Revue
Reviews.Author: Rush A. Kerlin Jr.
Reviews.Content: Camera is as good as advertised. Have no idea how long the battery will last as I do not use it that much and have had it only a month or so.  Otherwise, it is great.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: W. Donovan
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend loves it! thanks canon for making a great product! the color accent is our favorite feature.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I've ever used!
Reviews.Author: D. DeVincenzi
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this camera, and I can now safely say that I made the right choice when I bought the SX200. The picture quality is excellent, the full assortment of manual controls is great, and the overall build quality of the camera is second to none. I have yet to encounter an aspect of the camera which I do not like. I would have thought the ever-present pop-up flash would be distracting and cumbersome, but you really don't notice it at all. Another aspect of this camera that really impresses me is how fast you can take multiple pictures. In good light, I can easily squeeze off three pictures in less than two seconds. That's a great feature that no other P&S; I've ever used has been able to match. Overall, I really can't see how you can go wrong with the SX200 and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something more than your average P&S; camera.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Purchase!  Very happy!
Reviews.Author: Goosey "Goosey"
Reviews.Content: The first digital camera I owned was a Canon, and it had gone everywhere with me for 6 years and outlived many cameras owned by friends and family. So when it came time to purchase another camera, I didn't look anywhere but to Canon.  I initially was going to go up to the DSLR, but with all of the outstanding specs and reviews attached to this camera, I decided to give it a chance and I am extremely happy that I did.  Not only is this camera a steal for its price, but it is very comparable in quality of pictures to that of the DSLR without the fuss and baggage.  This camera, while bigger than the PowerShots, is still compact enough to fit in your pocket, purse, or whatnot, for easily accessible photo opportunities.  The variety of options for photo shooting (night time, aquarium, snow, fireworks, sunset, etc.) are very useful and provide for more photo options while maintaining excellent quality.  It is also suited with a Li+ battery, as opposed to the AA battery operated Canons, which I prefer, and it has a remarkable battery life.  The screen is large and the resolution is excellent.  It does take some time to get accustomed to all of the new features attached to this camera, but once you do, you are limitless in the style and types of pictures you can take.  While being a little less user-friendly than the PowerShots, it is still a relatively easy camera to operate.  Overall I am very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Returned a Nikon Coolpix s630 because some pics were blurry. Not one blurry pic as yet with this camera.  I had an old Canon from 2002 that we just loved. Hardly any bad pics from that camera either.This is a great point and shoot camera with easy to use adjustments for an amateur like me.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great all around camera
Reviews.Author: John Del Valle
Reviews.Content: works great. takes great pictures, only complaint is it takes a little long for second shot.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX200IS
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: What an awesome camera !!!!!!  I have not yet learned all about all the possibilities, but I'm so happy with the 12X zoom lens and the wide angle.  I first saw this camera when my cousin bought his and I was amazed at the size of the lens at first viewing.  I investigated more about the camera and finally decided that this was the camera that I wanted.  We recently went on a cruise to the Western Caribbean and my pictures are so much superior to others that I saw.I highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants awesome pictures with terrific zoom qualities and extremely good low light results.  Check this one out before buying any other point and shooter.

Reviews.Title: zoom, zoom, zoom!
Reviews.Author: J. Reynolds "true amateur"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Canon digital camera and the best so far. The zoom is superb. Got so many great pictures I have entered several in a photo contest.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: R. L. Basinger
Reviews.Content: Overall, I love this camera.  I've been using cameras with a lot of features for more than 25 years, so for me this is easy to use.  But I can see somebody being overwhelmed by the various features and settings if all they've ever used is a point and shoot. For those people, there's an "Easy" mode that will take care of everything for them and they can learn everything else it does a feature or two at a time.  It's too early to rate the battery life.  Because I've just been playing with it a lot, I don't know how it will do in real life situations, but so far it looks like I'll be happy with it.  I bought a spare battery at the same time (Amazon Marketplace) that turned out to be defective.  As soon as I brought it to the seller's attention, they sent me a new battery and a prepaid return label to send the dead one back.  Very good customer service.  What really impresses me is the zoom in a camera this size.  At full telephoto of 48x (12x optical and 4x digital zoom), I have handheld some shots that by all rights should have shown a lot of camera shake, but they are in relatively good focus.  I haven't printed any of them yet - just viewed them on my laptop, but they look pretty good.  I imagine they'll be great when I use a tripod.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Tibs "Tibs"
Reviews.Content: Worth every cent. Excellent quality pics and video: crisp, great color, great audio. Excellent quality when used even by a novice or first timer, yet all the features available for those more on the pro side. I use a large capacity card and keep an extra battery on me. I am sooooooooooooo pleased with this!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera in a small package
Reviews.Author: T. Bickford
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera from Amazon just before a trip to Europe.  We didn't have much time to go over all of the features before leaving but managed to get some great photos.  The zoom is excellent, picture quality is excellent and it is very easy to use.  Battery life is also good.  Have not used the video feature yet so can not comment on that.  I bought an 8GB card to go with it which allowed for some 2,000+ pictures to be stored at high resolution.  I highly recommend this camera if you are lookig for a compact design with loads of features and great optical zoom.  Also pleasantly surprised to find it was made in Japan not China.

Reviews.Title: Solid and Sleek Performer
Reviews.Author: Cville Dude
Reviews.Content: I've been a big fan of Canon and this is my second point and shoot made by Canon.  After trying Olympus and Sony I believe Canon offer the best value today.The SX200IS is an ideal camera for taking a lot of close quarter shots.  The wide angle lens give great depth and perspective to photos.  Photos of people, babies and objects look much richer with this camera than others I've used.  After comparing the same shots with others cameras I'm convinced this is a great value.  The 12MP is nice but not as important as the lighting and auto-features this camera provides.This camera is bigger than the ultra slim models and wont fit in your pants pocket (unless you wear giant pants) but the extra features and image quality make up for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Y. KIM
Reviews.Content: Nice Camera...recommended.  It's bit pricey but definitely worth buying.  I have few digicam that can take just plain photos.  This one will definitely do some magic with closeup photos, sunset, catch movement....I was amazed to see the quality of photo when I took a picture of MOON.  With 48x combined Zoom came out great...play around with the software provided...you can print amazing photo.This is one of few cameras that give you all the different photo settings, manual setting with 12X zoom.Watch out that popup flash...you may drop the camera...but once you get used to it, it won't bother you.

Reviews.Title: Great product I ever owned!
Reviews.Author: C. Fan
Reviews.Content: You can still use zoom function while making video. One only cons is you might need a 16 G memory card if you want to take movie for 1 hour long.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Sally
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 14 months ago. I do not use my camera everyday, perhaps a day or two a month. When I was going to take a picture by zooming in last week, my lens got stuck open. I got the apparently infamous message, "Lens error, restart camera". My camera would not start. My warranty expired two months prior so when I called Canon for help they said to mail it in, which cost me $15. After searching online before I even spoke with the person I knew what they were going to tell me--it was my fault for the error from having dropped the camera or getting sand or water in it. I know that I didn't do these things, as I take care of my camera and have not brought it to the beach before. I also knew they would charge me $130 to fix it and ship it back with a 90-day warranty on the repair. After haggling with the customer service representative she offered me a 20% discount on labor, taking my bill down to $115 (mind you a new one now costs $200), or selling me a refurbished camera for $40 less than the brand new camera with no warranty since it's refurbished so its warranty expired. I have owned Canons in the past and been very pleased, but this camera is a LEMON!! You do not want to waste your money on it. It's such a disappointment, and I am disappointed that Canon has sold such a bad camera and not taken responsibility for its manufacturing error. It's an embarrassment that they would sell it, as it has forever tarnished my impression of Canon. I will not purchase another Canon camera after this experience.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: JustP
Reviews.Content: Had the camera for about a year. Was overall happy with it, but the moving parts started to wear out on me.  The flash would start getting stuck and then one day I got the infamous "Lens Error".  This made the camera unusable. While it lasted the camera was nice, but I couldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Avoid Entirely
Reviews.Author: PT
Reviews.Content: I ignored the warnings from others about the fatal "Lens Error" that renders this camera unusable. Canon refuses to warranty this condition. Camera was never abused in any way and is 3 months old. Apparently, this afflicts many Canon cameras.Shame on Canon. This is highly irresponsible.

Reviews.Title: Auto mode issues
Reviews.Author: M. Knapp
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Auto and Easy modes indoor picture quality. Good to great pictures can be taken when in one of the manual modes but I purchased this as a high end point and shoot camera. In the Auto modes colors are washed out and any lighting fixture in picture becomes a white blob from high ISO setting these modes usually choose. Focus also struggles in these modes. I would welcome any advice or software updates to camera to fix this. I have seen this complaint from other feedback sites so expect this is normal for this camera. Like everything else with camera, unfortunately I need a good Auto mode camera where I can reasonably expect good results when passing it off to my wife or children. Wanting to love it but still debating whether to return.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Video Quality!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Mattoso
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  I just got it in the mail a few days ago, and it works wonders!I immediately started shooting some pictures, and the picture quality is unreal.  Real HD (well...pretty much!).  There are a lot of different features, and once you know how to use them (I am still learning by the way), you will be amazed and consider yourself a professional photographer!  You can crop, change colors etc all in the camera.  I love it!  The only "bad" thing (which really isn't that bad), is that I basically bought this camera to replace my old PowerShot, and thought that I could use the battery from the old one as an additional battery for the PowerShot SX200 IS.  But, the battery from SX 200 IS is shorter and wider, so I can't really use the old Canon PowerShot battery.  But that's ok though! The life of the battery is great!The picture colors are ridiculous, really! They are so vivid.  It looks like I am litterally holding what I shot.  The zoom, no comments! It's FANTASTIC! You can take picture from so far away! It's awesome...I am very impressed and proud of this purchase!  I agree with the "negative" reviews:  its not for point and shoot users.  But it can be.  Just change the setting to "Easy" mode OR the "Manual" mode and you're good to go!It's a little bigger than your regular digital cameras out there, but nothing crazy.  It fits better in larger hands anyway...:-)

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SX200IS
Reviews.Author: D. Vachhani
Reviews.Content: I'm thrilled with the clarity of the photos and the zoom...it's amazing.  The only thing critical I can say...is that its tough to be steady when you get up to 48x and I'd prefer to have the choice of the flash popping up...though you can hold it down if its in the way.Overall, I'm impressed with the photos and its very easy to use.  My family absconded mine to take on safari in Africa...and it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS
Reviews.Author: Claudia De Caravantes
Reviews.Content: Best camera.  Easy to use, easy to carry.  Great resolution.  Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sx200is review
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Young
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is small and sleek and takes the best pictures I have ever taken.  The zoom is incredible so I can be far away and get those candid shots no problem.  My hand shakes a little but this camera takes care of that.  It also takes care of red eye.  Want a small powerful no fuss camera...this one is for you.

Reviews.Title: very good advanced point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Poe
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the SX200 because I wanted a small p/s that had some advanced features.  The SX200 has manual aperture and shutter speed controls if you want complete control (of course the aperture range is only from 3.5 to 8.0 - not a large range), or you can put it on the "easy" setting and just click away not worrying about any of the settings.  The camera is larger than some ultra-compact cameras, but with a 12x zoom you sort of expect that.  Before you buy any camera, you have to figure out what you'll be using the camera for ultimately.  This camera is not a dSLR, and will never match a 1DS, 5D, 20D, etc. - this camera is only $300!  Also, if you want a strictly point and shoot and nothing more, look at canon's elph or A series cameras - the SX200 is probably more then you need.  But if you want the best of both worlds, then you have found your camera.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Shihai He "shihai"
Reviews.Content: this camera is between easy ones and professional ones. relatively easy to use and the pictures have high quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera in a small package
Reviews.Author: D. Davidovic "EnjoyReading"
Reviews.Content: I was considering moving from my Powershot to a digital SLR but decided to try this one first.  I am very happy with my choice.  Although not as full-featured as an SLR with lens interchangeability, it is a great little camera with lots of features and still pocketable.A couple of things could be better.- Yes, I do have the tendency to have my finger over the pop-up flash preventing it from popping, but not the end of the world.- The dor to the USB connector is the flimsiest thing I have ever seen.  If that door lasts 6 months without breaking off I'll be amazed.  I had the same issue with my little Powershot and you'd think they would have improved it by now.  I see scotchtape (or a return) in my future.

Reviews.Title: SX200IS - a complete compact camera
Reviews.Author: William Lim
Reviews.Content: Only comera with 12x optical zoom with optical image stablizer system.  Furthermore with 12 megapixels and 2 inch TFT color LCDD widescreen with wide viewing angle everyone will like to own one.  One camera to bring along for any holiday.Highly recommended esp those who wants to travel light.

Reviews.Title: It's ok but it's going back
Reviews.Author: K. Chamberland
Reviews.Content: I have a Panasonic DMC TZ5 which is great but I am always wanting to try the newest thing out. I have been know to get a new camera every year searching for the perfect compact camera. Well, I gave this canon a try, found too many things I didn't like and now it is going back. Thanks to Amazon for making returns so painless.CONS:1. The canon takes great outside photos but inside shots leave a lot to be desired. They are not well focused and colors are not true, no matter which setting you use.2. I also do not like the pop up flash. It feels rickity and is in a position to be bumped all the time since it located right where you put you left fingers. You cannot make it stay down even when you set the flash to forced off. I'm sure that some point it will get broken off.3. the camera does not go to sleep so it can be awakened by just touching a button; it actually shuts off and needs to be turned back on when a photo op comes along. Also, if you spend too much time reviewing your photos and then try to go back to shooting, you can't. It has shut off. ALthough start up is fairly fast, it is not as fast a a button push for wake up. Time means the difference between getting that shot of a lifetime or not.4. it is very slippery and easily slips out of your hand. There is no good place for your right fingers to make it feel secure and no anti-slip strip to keep it safer.5. It is not as easy to use as they claim.You want easy - go for the Panasonic.PROS1. Great outdoors photos with good color.2. The one thing it did for me was make me appreciate what a great camera the Panasonic TZ5 is. If you are in the market for a new compact camera get the Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, but it broke after 45 days with "lens error restart camera" message
Reviews.Author: Scott McMullan
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Canon point and shoots, having had an s110, s400, s800, and now sx200 over the years.  The sx200 takes wonderful pictures and movies...But the lens mechanisms have to be fixed!- My new canon sx200 just stopped working after 45 days -- the lens won't close and I get a "lens error restart camera" message that I can't get rid of.- A couple years ago, my canon s400 suffered the dreaded E18 lens error after 18 months of use and became a wonderful paper weight.I would take it back but Amazon says my return window just expired May 9th :-(So now I have to go through the hassle of getting a warranty repair for a camera that I no longer trust.Canon I hope you're listening!

Reviews.Title: expected more
Reviews.Author: Evgeny Kolev
Reviews.Content: I spent months reading - reviews, comparisons, characteristics. Decided to add a Canon to my collection and go with the Canon SX200 IS and not the Panasonic rivals ZS1/3 (DMC-TZ6/7 in Europe) - my other and close choice.Ordered the camera online. I knew I am not getting a viewfinder (this class of 'compact super zoom' basically decided to skip it, which is quite painful especially when shooting in bright light). I also knew of the annoying feature to have the flash out every time you want to use the camera. Didn't expect the following problem - the door on the battery/memory opens every time I touch it (e.g. trying to get it out of the camera bag), while at the same time the door on the the AV outputs has top be struggled with to get it opne. Played with the many functions - all nice, but the quality of the pictures weren't as impressive as I expected. The HD video is OK only at no or minimum zoom, so I decided no zooming in video mode (which was one of the nice features the camera has).And then the big disappointment came when after only 175 shots the camera broke - the lenses + flash came out and never went back in.Which ruined half of my vacation for which the camera was purchased. Back in the US - took it to the service. Got 10 days later a refurbished different camera - the letter said mine couldn't be fixed for the lack of parts (!?). They used FedEx which was completely inconvenient for me, but added a news et of battery-stripe-charger, so the wasted time and gas might have been worthed (not).Took about 50 shots with the "new" camera + some videos. The videos came up with striping, so I might be visiting the service again :-(Not the quality from Canon I expected - neither in the performance, not the mechanics.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Coal Monger
Reviews.Content: I debated over this and the G10. I chose the SX200 because of the zoom. It takes excellent photos!It is not a tiny pocket camera. It has some weight and size to it.Excellent job Canon!

Reviews.Title: Zoom lens is VERY VERY FRAGILE
Reviews.Author: snowblue
Reviews.Content: I owned this three months. I hit the ON button by accident while it was in its case. The zoom lens popped open then shut now it WONT open at all.I contacted Canon and they wanted $175 to fix it. The gears inside he lens are CHEAPLY made. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: This is the One!! Canon SX200IS
Reviews.Author: Robert H. McBride "RV Driver"
Reviews.Content: I read reviews and comparisons for several months before purchasing the SX200IS.  Save yourself the trouble and get this one before it goes away.  I like it way better than the 210 which is already marketed as its replacement.  (Mine is red, and it's a nice dark maroon.)  Until Canon replaces the SX20IS and includes a larger sensor (as in the Sony NEX3/5), there is no reason to go with a larger body camera with the small sensor used in most point and shoots.  I almost bought the SX20IS, but realized I should wait for the larger sensor.  Until then, I am even happier with this camera that I expected to be. The 12x optical zoom, including wide angle in this small a body is an excellent compromise.For some BACKGROUND PERSPECTIVE: Consider that I have been taking pictures for over 50 years, including the last 40 with two Canon FT-QL SLRS with all the appropriate lenses, and a Sony DSC-85 for the last 10.  The Canon SX200IS allows me to do anything (and more) I could do with the SLRs and four lenses from 28mm to 400mm (560mm on the SX200IS), all in one package that fits in my pocket!  The ten years from the Sony 3.3 MP to the 12 MP Canon also gave me a great leap in image quality.  Leaving the image quaility on the highest setting gives photos of about 3.5 MB each.  That's plenty of data for editing, cropping, printing or projects (like photo books), and everyone that looks at my photos is amazed at the color and quality of the images.  I have had the SX200 for about two months (an early Fathers Day gift to myself) and have taken about 400 photos (not counting any I have deleted), mostly on Auto, including a wedding reception and a military funeral.  I already made four photo books, and they all turned out very well.READ THE User's Manual, and then read it again!!  I'm still learning more cool stuff this camera will do.  BTW, my camera included a small format copy of the manual (Canon reads these reviews, I guess), but I had already downloaded it from the Canon website and had it printed and bound in large format, so the small copy stays in my bag with the camera.  That's the other thing, this camera goes everywhere I go, since it's small enough to fit in one of the pockets of my shoulder bag that I take to work and in the car on weekends.I like the ability to control exposure and focus myself, and I am still learning all the various options.  If you just want to turn it on and take great pictures, don't worry about it.  Just do it, and you'll be happy.  The videos are great too, BTW!The pop up flash is NOT an issue. Your left hand first finger gets used to the notch behind it, so you forget it very quickly.Quality, Solid construction!  Nice finish.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Wertz
Reviews.Content: On our initial impressions this camera is everything we wanted and more.  We bought this camera two days ago to replace our PowerShot SD630.  The SX200IS is just a bit larger than the SD630 and is still pocket size and easily transportable.  The various modes available on the camera are great that make it easy for point-and-shoot users.  The 3" LCD screen is a lot sharper than our previous SD630.With its small size, 12x optical zoom, HD video capability, and huge 12 MP picture size at $350 half of what my previous camera cost I couldn't be happier with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great in many ways
Reviews.Author: BadBrad
Reviews.Content: Overall I am very pleased with this camera. The quality for such a small camera is very good and the 12x zoom is fantastic. I have had trouble with the HD video filming for longer than 30 seconds or so. For some reason it just cuts of and saves the video. Smaller videos appear to be fine. I have looked at settings but can't seem to see anything restricting the length of the video.Overall a great buy in such a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: FGL
Reviews.Content: Love it. Small. Manual and automatic. Great videos. Great price. Holds a charge for a long time.Fits in jean pockets.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy with camera, want to return it
Reviews.Author: mary furness
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in the camera's ability- or NON-ability to focus in midrange.  Had one before and this is why I bought another, but it will not focus from 3 ft to about 20 feet with zoom

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Shep
Reviews.Content: Totally Happy with purchase. Meimei is the BOMB!!! Very Nice to work with. A 100% favorable buying experience! Camera was more than described

Reviews.Title: As a put in your pocket point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Not_you
Reviews.Content: ...it is easy, lots of pixels, fast, all in all for what it is a great grab and go camera with very good results.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Sheryl S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for a my novice photographer husband. It takes great pictures and the manual makes it easy to learn.

Reviews.Title: I love love love this camera
Reviews.Author: D. Ottinger "Amazon buyer"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use and takes the most beautiful pictures I have ever had....I would definitely buy this exact same camera again if anything ever happened to the one I have.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ann Neubauer
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. It has everything you want and need in a point and shoot with tons of additional options like manual, etc. I actually dropped mine in the Gulf of Mexico - EEK! And I went right back to cannon and bought the same model (newer addition!). It's worth every penny. The zoom is AMAZING and it still fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great quality !!
Reviews.Author: Isaac Dyck
Reviews.Content: absolutely great quality of pictures (i receive this one in less time than expected)simple line : great camera and by a great price...!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: s.patton
Reviews.Content: This camera has gone everywhere with me and I absolutely love it! It takes fantastic pictures. We have a boat and I use this everytime some is wakeboarding. I'm able to catch them in mid air when they jump or wreck. I fell off the boat seat while taking pictures and broke the flash :( I taped it down and have used the camera like that for about a year now. I can't take night pictures of course, but the fall didn't affect its day performance at all.

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera with Great Features
Reviews.Author: M. Hockett
Reviews.Content: The camera produces fine pictures with rich colors.  The anti-shake lens system is quite effective when zooming in distant subjects at x12.  It has a better quality elevated flash that is very effective, and the rechargeable battery retains its charge impressively.  The camera costs more, but it offers more.

Reviews.Title: Good durable camera
Reviews.Author: Neel
Reviews.Content: At the time this camera was released, it was a gem for its era. Even now, it can compete with decent cameras. However, for those who are thinking of buying it, I would suggest a camera that has video incorporated into it as well. The new Canon Powershots, while around the same price (or less) usually are equipped with 1080 P video quality. That will not need to act as your main video camera but it will be useful in random situations, like when your video camera is out of charge.Overall the camera is excellent. The 12X optical zoom works remarkably well. In addition, the camera has up to 48X digital zoom. Digital zoom sacrifices pixels for zoom and most editing software can do it, but it is nice to be able to visualize your "zoomed" photo on the camera itself.I once dropped this camera from about four feet onto solid ground. The result was that the bottom of the zoom lens was damaged. This did not affect the camera much. I see it as a well worth investment because it has lasted over 3 years. Now I am only think of replacing it because I would like to have a video camera and a still camera in one device.Recently, it has begun to glitch as well. The glitches include disorientation of photo and the cameras defiance to follow preset settings. This is nothing major because it can be fixed by quickly restarting the camera.I am confident that if you take good care of the camera then it will not experience and major problems till after 5 years. I would have recommend buying it 2 years ago but now I might suggest looking into other canon models because they have more feature like video ability, more optical zoom, more megapixels, and some are even cheaper.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------On the link below, you will find another Canon Powershot that Amazon is selling. It is $180 cheaper and has 1080 P video. It only lacks higher zoom but it has more megapixels:http://www.amazon.com/Canon-PowerShot-Stabilized-Wide-Angle-Recording/dp/B006UMM1UO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1342571610&sr;=8-1&keywords;=canon+powershot

Reviews.Title: Great for pix, cheap material
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a little over a year ago.  I read a review that stated that the bottom, where you put the battery in, was made of plastic.  I thought to myself 'Hey its a Canon, they wouldn't make it cheap enough to break, its probably hard plastic."  Well, the camera takes great pics, BUT unfortunately, the bottom broke, and I believe its not holding the battery in properly, so my battery life doesn't last long now.  I called Canon to see if they could help me out with this issue and they said it would cost approx $125 to fix.  So, I am going to try to figure out a mickey mouse way of fixing this.If you are looking to get this camera, know that it takes wonderful images.  I have had no internal issues with it, and have taken semi professional looking images with it.  I am somewhat saddened that I am going to have to replace it with another camera, but I cant handle cheap material.  I truly can't believe they went with cheap plastic to hold the battery in place.  Stupid move.  If you buy it, baby it.  It's not worth spending $125 to fix.  Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA for 15 months then LENS ERROR
Reviews.Author: Quinn
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I enjoyed this camera when it worked great for 15 months.Then out of nowhere, I received the Lens Error.I had to repaired, but even when it was repaired, it was not the same afterwards.This camera shot great photos, videos, and is a little clunky to carry around.You won't be putting it comfortably in your pants pocket anytime soon, but it takes great photos.However, the lens error part was heartbreaking.Really came out of nowhere!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX200is is a lemon
Reviews.Author: Camera Guy
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for just a little over a year. It has had problems since day one, as it became sluggish in operation almost immediately. However, when the lens cover leaves quit opening and closing all the way we had to return it to Canon for repair. They supposedly fixed it but conditioned their repair "as is." Now just a few months later the lens cover leaves are no longer opening and closing. Of course they won't fix it under warranty. We are very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for me
Reviews.Author: Aaron Hageman "aaronus"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect one for me.  I purchased about the month after it came out.My camera needs include long range zoom for when I'm up on a mountain, as well as very close up shots for the tiny flowers God made.  It can focus all the way up to touching the lens...although you might block out the light.Take note, though.  This camera does not support RAW format, but since I don't do professional editing and sizes, that's fine with me.  The flash is almost pathetic in its lack of brightness.  Low-light shots often don't turn out well.The scroll wheel on the back of the camera is life changing.  Instead of clicking through all of my pictures, I just roll the wheel and go much faster.The camera's easy to hang on to.  The LCD screen is lovely.I've read about Canon's updated models in this line, and they all seem to lack one or the other of the qualities I appreciate about this model.  They might not have the focus all the way to the lens, or they might lack the scroll wheel.  They did improve the low light issue, though.If you need a good all around camera that is not too heavy, has super zoom options, good quality photos of all sorts, and allows manual controlling or automatic settings as you prefer and learn, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: you look better in the pic than real lfe...
Reviews.Author: donial
Reviews.Content: Takes amazing pictures, the color looks amazing and NEVER washes people out...taking pictures with this camera,makes the pictures look better than all other cameras and better looking than real life...I have owned ALOT of different brands, and by far this is my favorite...Years ago I had a 35mm canon and it was my favorite,until I used the life out of it...so I knew I wanted to spend a little extra money to get another canon,thank god I did!..you will not be disapointed!Video: Unlike some digital cameras, this camera you can zoom in and out after starting the  video.And the sound is great too...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: H. Miller
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for taking wildlife shots. With a combined 48x zoom, you can take closeups from 100's of yards away.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mikeyc
Reviews.Content: This is one of the fastest point and shoots you can buy. Had this camera for about 6 months very happy

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its price
Reviews.Author: Fabricio Marin
Reviews.Content: I must say, for a camera at this price im quite pleased. Ive had this camera for over a year now and its still working okay. the reason i say "okay" is because the picture quality seems to be diminishing. Lots of noise is created when zoomed in above 12X or when the ISO is set above 400 (i find this very disappointing) Taking pictures at 48X zoom or 1600 ISO is pretty much uselessI however, edit my photos on Photoshop to reduce the noise and improve the overall quality, see for yourself: [...]

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS 12 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: L. Ocampo "osl"
Reviews.Content: I think it is an excellent choice if you want a compact camera with many functions and an excellent optical zoom. it takes great pictures in different ways you handle.

Reviews.Title: powershot sx200IS
Reviews.Author: t.l.g.
Reviews.Content: This product came in a timely manner. It was packaged in its original box with all its instructions and warranties. The camera is light weight and  easy to adjust from one mode to the next. The battery life is excellent I can charge it and use it over the next 2-3 weeks without another charge. The product is well made and solid it is a little bulky but if your looking for a pocket camera this is not it but it easily slide into a jacket pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Sx200IS
Reviews.Author: Emily Ginko
Reviews.Content: Small enough to fit in a pocket and powerful enough to get close-ups without all the attachments one has to carry with bigger cameras.  As a teacher and Mother it fits all my needs in a camera

Reviews.Title: Canon SX200IS
Reviews.Author: David Porter
Reviews.Content: A recent vacation allowed me to exercise the SX200IS's abilities. I had already decided that the Auto mode did just fine in any of the things I had tried, so all pics, indoors or outside, were shot in auto. I ran the lens from full wide to full optical plus digital zoom, taking pictures of Mt. Rainier, St Helens, the Columbia Gorge and Japanese gardens. In most cases the camera was handheld, with no rest. Despite the not-so-hot images I saw on the LCD, the finished product on the computer turned out beautifully. The naked eye (mine at least) could find no sign of degraded resolution, even on the longest zoom, even in 8x10 prints. I had previously noticed that the "sharpen" tool in Picasa did not seem to alter the images at all, in contrast to the older digital camera I had used, where all images were greatly enhanced by Picasa. I have had no problems with the camera in the year I have been using it (a lot). I would recommend it to anyone who wanted to have high quality images with an easy to use point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good camera.
Reviews.Author: duckrabbit
Reviews.Content: This camera has met or exceeded all expectations.  It's very easy to use and so far has been problem free.  The captured images are top notch. A professional photographer or someone who is extremely particular about one small feature or another might be able to find a problem, but the average person should be very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Shauna M. Sherman "I'maGem04"
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use, takes stunning pictures, and has a nice look. I am completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Eve1
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I received it very fast after I ordered it.  It's easy to use, but also has controls where you can adjust more like an slr if you prefer. I am an avid photographer and wanted a smaller camera that I could have with me all of the time.  While this isn't as small as some of them, it is small enough to carry in a purse or pocket.  I had a smaller camera and was not pleased with the time lag in shooting and some of the pictures did not come out very well.  This camera has a 12x zoom, which is great for a camera this size.  It also takes great pictures whether you're taking them on the go or setting up a shot.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph E. Garside
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the quality of photos taken, and surprised at length of battery life. Charged once a month ago and still using. I am a little disappoint with flash location and its pop up for I seem to always have my finger over it and hope it does not get damaged from holding down.

Reviews.Title: Bush Pilot
Reviews.Author: Bush Pilot
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Lots of features. Like the solid feel and Cannon lens. Takes great pictures and is easy to use. Don't like the pop up flash. May be able to disable so doesn't get in the way, but haven't researched this yet. Apparently zoom does not work in movie mode when using optical mode.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Donna K. Schirmer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my daughter for Christmas.  She loves it and carries it everywhere we go!  Great product.  Thanks Canon

Reviews.Title: The best you can get for a compact camera
Reviews.Author: David Russel
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have everything, but it has quite a lot for such a small camerathe manual options are great and enables those who know how to use them to get some creative photo shooting, while the auto modes are very smart enabling normal point and shoot users to get really good pics too.the lens is quite big for such a small camera and the zoom too is great.the only two drawbacks I see in that little monster, is the fact that the flash can't be closed, it has to stay up while the camera is on.the second one is that the continuous mode is useless when the camera can only shoot 0.8 frame/second, but I suspect you can get better from such a small camera.overall, in this size range it's amazing, If you want more you'll have to go to SLR range

Reviews.Title: Awesome images and HD Video
Reviews.Author: John T. Mason IV "Signal6"
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little concerned about what I might get, but it was unfounded. Other than the small problem where my finger sometimes holds down the flash (it's in a bad position), this is an amazing camera.It's my first Canon, and I was not disappointed. I took this on a trip to Central America into some rough country and it held up well. Also, the HD video was of amazing quality. The sound was way better than I have ever heard on a camera like this, and the picture quality was first class.This was a great buy! I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Clark "Kimberly Clark"
Reviews.Content: the zoom is great.  cant see so far away yet can stick the camera into my pocket

Reviews.Title: finally made my decision
Reviews.Author: Army_Wifey
Reviews.Content: First just want to share my experience...I got this camera before thanksgving, but there's a problem...I returned it to amazon, because there's a tiny dead pixel on the LCD I dont know if thats normal, it did'nt give me a peace of mind and it's so annoying everytime you look at your LCD, so i returned and amazon replaced it for free, Thanks for them.I really love this camera, made a lot of research then it really convinced me to buy this, all I can say this camera is compact and very powerful for zoom, you'll get used to the pop out flash...also got my review for this camera at this link:[...]Hope this also could help for some buyers!

Reviews.Title: One of the easiest cameras I have used
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Moraine "Mike, " movie buff ""
Reviews.Content: This is one of the easiest cameras that I have used with excellent results, not for a pro, but very well suited for us laymen of cameras

Reviews.Title: No Rewards for Customer Loyalty
Reviews.Author: Jim Zacks
Reviews.Content: I have bought two of these cameras, one for my daughter-in-law and one for my wife and for me to use as a pocket camera.  When it was functioning the camera performed well, as I have come to expect from the many Canon cameras that I have owned.  However, one of the two cameras jammed with the lens partially extended and had to be sent in for repair, about 3 months out of warranty.  It had not been mishandled or otherwise abused, it simply jammed.  After complaining to Canon about the lack of reward for customer loyalty or the fact that it was only 3 months out of warranty Canon offered to reduce the standard repair cost my a very modest amount.  In an age where companies spend large sums of money to attract customers, it seems foolish that they were not willing to go the extra mile to cover this repair completely to retain a good customer.  Obviously my previous instinct to return to Canon automatically rather than go for the camera with the best review has been extinguished.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed Canon fan
Reviews.Author: M. Kim
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Canon and I have owned many Canon products in the past with no troubles, however, my recent purchase of Canon PowerShot SX200IS has been very disappointing.  This could be an isolated incident but I am not a happy customer.  I bought this camera because it's a Canon and because of its powerful zoom lens capacity and digital picture quality, however within days (2nd time taking picture on the 10th day) of purchase the zoom lens stopped retracting and became completely useless.  I usually don't buy extended insurances offered by retailer b/c I will simply refuse to buy same brand if it falls below what I come to expect from certain products.  I have sent in the camera to the Canon Factory Service Center for repair at my time and cost.  I am waiting for its return.  I have never sent in a product back to manufacturer for repair before.  Let's see how this repair thing works out.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Little Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Maloney
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that does it all..but is simple to work...this is it!  I am not the techie kind of person.  I wanted simple with flexibility and have it with this camera.  Plenty of settings from Automatic to portrait to landscape to action and if you want to set shutter speed & apature you can do that too.  It even has video capabilities.The ease of use is a godsend.  One button the turn it on, one to zoom in and one to take the photo.  You press down the button to take the photo 1/2 way and it focuses the shot. Push down the rest of the way and snap your photo.  If the camera can't focus on what you are trying to shoot because you are too close or some other reason then the button won't go the whole way down.  I like this feature.  I'm sure that it would be more valuable in a film camera...however no use wasting memory for no good reason.Photos come out clear.  It's easy to delete photos as you go or all at once.  I haven't worked much with the video settings yet.If you need a reliable camera that takes great photos this is it!

Reviews.Title: Lens Error and Canon refuses to fix this consistent manufacturer's problem
Reviews.Author: J. Bray "Toby Wan Kenobi"
Reviews.Content: Same problems as many other 1-star reviewers.  Out of the blue, I kept getting a lens-error.  I've had this problem on other cameras, but it was only a temporary problem.  On this camera, it is a permanent problem and makes the camera unusable.  Canon is absolutely no help as they continue to manufacture cameras with this problem (google "lens error"+ canon) and refuses to make better cameras or fix them without $180 fee.  I am currently shopping for a new camera and it won't be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Becka "Becka"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera- the macro is just as amazing as I expected. My only complaint is that the image quality is a little worse in low light, but that may be just in comparison to the superb macro images.

Reviews.Title: Power Pack Camera
Reviews.Author: Tintin "Tintin"
Reviews.Content: This camera is for folks who wants to take a leap to intermediate level of picture taking. For people who want more than just point and shoot. Since a lot of features have been placed in this camera it is a little bulky compared to SD1200IS which was my alternate choice. Most of the major store that i went to don't have this model on display so i have to bite the bullet and order it and than find out if it is easy to carry around in my pocket. What i found that it does not easily fit into trouser pockets. However overall i love this camera's capability. One of the thing to watch out from is the popping up of flash. To avoid dropping the camera it is a good idea to always put your hands through the wrist strap and than operate the camera. The popping of flash gives less area to grip the camera. I wished they kept the flash design same as SD series. The flash recharging time is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Carley Manning
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned.  The features are great and the picture is just amazing!

Reviews.Title: Did Not Last for a Few Months
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I got my Canon SX 200IS on February 2010 and it stopped working today (November 2010) without any reason. It gives an error "Lens problem, restart the camera" and Canon company charges 94$ to repair it. I don't know what to do. I spent lots of money on it and it does not work now.

Reviews.Title: Not fast enough
Reviews.Author: Nanzilla "Nanzilla"
Reviews.Content: My Canon Digital Elph from 2005 has a slightly faster shutter speed. I like to catch action, and although this camera takes incredibly better photos than my Elph, the frames per second are severely lacking for 5 years later if you want to continuous shoot and get some action shots.It's a bit big and the battery does not last as long as my 2005 camera either.I did return it, just waiting for my refund.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Linda Rainville
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera but it does have a learning curve as there are many options available. Any problems with it I think have been operator problems (me) not the camera. The more I use it the better I like it. I was using a Sony camera so this is a bit different. I love the 12x optical zoom and that is mostly the reason I bought it.

Reviews.Title: another hit from Canon
Reviews.Author: Smith
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased Canon's PowerShot SX200IS.  I have fount it easy to use with lots of options.  It takes great pictures.  The only thing I don't think is well done as the rest of the caamera is the flash but overall it is a great camera and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera....but
Reviews.Author: ckar
Reviews.Content: The build quality is great, aside from the plastic door for the inputs.  However, the flash is a real pain.  No matter what, every time you turn on the camera the flash pops up.  I found myself having to adjust my grip on the camera.  Why wouldn't Canon just incorporate the flash into the body of the camera like most of their other PowerShots??!!!  My pictures at high-zoom levels were pretty average.  I've come to the conclusion that if you want big zoom, buy a DSLR with a big lens!  Pocket point-and-shoots just can't compare when it comes to producing nice images at high zooms.

Reviews.Title: It took a long and hard research, but this one won.
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for beginners and  advanced users. I would suggest reading the manual if you want to be technical with your photos. Can't complain about video otherwise I'd get myself a camcorder or the CANON SX20 IS which was my other debate but I needed a compact camera for now.  I can't complain about this camera because I used to have a cybershot, so it's a major upgrade!

Reviews.Title: Excellent all-in-one camera
Reviews.Author: PeaceForAll
Reviews.Content: I have come to firmly believe that Canon's point-and-shoot quality and clarity is simply unbeatable in the industry for many years now. I have owned SONY, Olympus, Fuji in the past. Tested several Panasonic and other cameras. Nothing even comes close to Canon's quality of outputs.Some people here compared this to Panasonic DMC-ZS3. HELLO ??? This new camera is  12.1MP while the DMC-ZS3 is 10MP only.  You may ask whether extra 2.1MP makes a big difference? Well for 350+ bucks and for my kid's close-ups and editable portraits, HELL YEAH!This is an awesome compact camera with great beginner to professional features. It would take me many months before I realize its true potential but its intuitive manual and on-screen interfaces guide me whenever I need to play with advanced settings.If you are on tight budget and want to buy just one camera for your family, this is it.Of course, this camera has its flaws like bad placement of flip-up flash, slightly bulkier, but Canon's quality outputs more than make up for such flaws.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - as long as you keep it indoors...
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Layne, III
Reviews.Content: My first impressions with the camera were fantastic. It was like buying a point-and-shoot with the legendary Canon picture quality, only with SLR-like controls and a big-ole lens slapped on top - the perfect solution for an adventure traveler that wanted high quality photos, but couldn't be troubled to carry around a big DSLR. The DIGIC4 is an excellent processor, and the camera benefits from it by an almost magical ability to capture detail in even the most extreme "bad contrast" situations. I was very happy for about 6 months.I bought a Pelican 1010 to protect the camera, which fit like a glove. My thinking at the time was the pricey (by comparison) camera was worth a $20 case to protect, and I would just carry it in the little Pelican when I wasn't taking a picture. Then, despite these precautions, a few particles of dust managed to work their way INSIDE the outer lens. I tried blasting canned air through the body (very carefully), but couldn't reach it that way. Unfortunately, it was right in the middle and very obvious on pictures. I planned to limp along until I could pick up a new camera, but after a few months the dust finally worked itself out and I thought my problems were over.Wishful thinking. The problem came back in the middle of an 11-day trek across the Navajo Nation and got progressively worse. It also started affecting the camera's ability to open, close and zoom the lens... I'm guessing due to dust grit blocking the fragile plastic gears on the inside. The flash stopped going back in on power-down at about the same time. While Canon might have been able to repair it for a "modest" fee, there was no way I would be able to send it in, let alone get it back in the middle of a trip like that. Left with either gently nudging the lens to help it along, or not taking pictures, I chose the former and managed to get almost 3 more days from it before it ultimately gave up completely.By comparison my wife's little Canon SD1100 has continued to function great despite us having it out in a SAND STORM during this trip. Of course, if I could remove the lens when I'm in camp and clean the unit, I probably could have saved it (our friends with DSLRs did this very thing after the sand storm). I know it is an apples to oranges comparison, but the point is if the USER cannot remove the lens and clean the camera then the designers should design the camera to be nearly dust tight (as they did with the earlier  SD models).At first I thought this might just be the usual problems manufacturers run into when they first bring a new concept to market. However, I've since picked up a new SD900 camera and not 2 weeks later the same dust ingress issues have happened. Now, just months later, the lens is acting up as well signaling the imminent demise of the camera. It seems they've managed to screw up my beloved SD-line as well. I remember my old SD750 ran for years, and the lens worked fine all through the time I had it. It even worked with sand grinding away at the gears in it during the month or so before I upgraded. That same SD750 is still going strong today as my friend's camera... as the saying goes: "They just don't make 'em like they use to."

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Darwiche Yossi
Reviews.Content: Possitive: Very nice camera, with very good and nice functions, excelent quality, excelent zoom.Negative: Not small, medium size

Reviews.Title: Canon SX200 IS Review
Reviews.Author: Kimberly "Piano Cat"
Reviews.Content: I still am in the testing stages of this camera.  I FINALLY GOT IT!!!  Let me recommend to any interested buyers to go the EXTRA FEW DOLLARS to purchase this from a TRUSTED website.  I had ordered this from about 2-3 other websites for $20.00-$30.00 cheaper and they ALL ended up being "bait-and-hook" schemes!!  So far I REALLY love this camera.  I have previously had a Fuji S1000 which had some very similar capabilities to the Canon SX200, but WHOA!!  I like the Canon SOOOO much better - especially how compact it is for SOOOOOO many extra and awesome features.  I have to keep testing the super macro setting so that I can perfect that, because the Fuji seems to be able to do a better job there - but I've only have it for a week so I've got more to experiment.  With the 12.1 MP, the shots have been incredibly clear. And with the 12X zoom - I can see things I didn't think I would be able to see!!  Haha! Lets hope this camera continues to impress me!!

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Leah Marie
Reviews.Content: The pictures are great. Very easy to use all the extra functionality outside the AUTO feature.

Reviews.Title: Fatal "lens error" message
Reviews.Author: J. Gentry
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for 9 weeks then I got a "lens error" and now it's too late to return it to Amazon and Canon won't fix it. Don't risk buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Dropped then Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Well, very much liked this camera...small enough to fit in my pocket but with a nice zoom lense. Then I dropped it. Sounded a little grindy after that then the lens error.  Sounds like it might be a problem with the camera generally, but since I dropped it I can't fully blame canon.  I did get about 4 years out of it.  Canon wants $111 to fix.  Talk about setting the price right at the point of indifference.

Reviews.Title: Bad choice
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Greene "MGLadybug"
Reviews.Content: The camera is heavy and hunky -- definitely too bulky to carry in my purse.  But much more important:  It takes lousy pictures.  Photos taken on automatic are out of focus and poorly exposed.  I could not wait to send it back.

Reviews.Title: I think its good ?
Reviews.Author: D. Brown
Reviews.Content: I dont really have any experience with any good cameras so i really dont know what to compare this to. I do know the features seem really manual, which i probably would re think if i could go back. i knew this going in by reading other reviews and i thought what a good way to learn about settings, etc but its pretty over my head.i havent had the camera to long, so i am still hoping i figure it out and get better shots. it might help if i finish reading the manual ;) the zoom on it is amazing, it is a bit heavy to carry around and no way it will fit in to my jean pocket. i like that you can trim and resize images and videos right on the camera. i wish it it had a few more special features like the color settings and accents, but i guess they have photoshop for that now. the panoramic stitch option is a nice touch, i have yet to try it.the video is nice, like the hd quality, but you cannot use the zoom while locked in video mode. bummer. the playback sound is weak on the camera but when you actually play it on the computer/tv it picks up voice just fine.the battery life seems really low, i think for me it was around 120 shots, which when you are on a trip or a hike that goes quick. i just ordered another battery and keep it in the carry case.

Reviews.Title: Overall good camera
Reviews.Author: S ks "S ks"
Reviews.Content: Good: 12x zoom, wide angle, picture quality, HD video, scene modes, face detection timer, eye closed sensor, NTSC/PAL, manual settings, color accent, color swap.Bad: No optical zoom while video capture, flash remain outside all the time when camera is on.Overall a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot - a great choice.
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Browning
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Switzerland last Spring and one of the people in my group had the SX 200IS.  I was so impressed with her photo shots that I could not get, that I purchased this SX 200 IS camera for a trip to China, replacing a previous model Canon that did not have the 12x wide angle zoom.  I was amazed at what this camera could do and during my trip in China my co-travelers could not believe the great shots that I was able to get. My camera was stolen and I have just replaced it with the same model in spite of many sales people trying to convince me to upgrade to HD.  I am very satisfied and love the results that get with this SX 200IS.

Reviews.Title: Lost All My Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jannie "Gal"
Reviews.Content: After 3 months, the camera gave me a Memory Card Error message. I was unable to use the camera and I was unable to access the memory card from another camera or from a computer. I lost 3 months of pictures because I was unable to access the memory card. I ready other reviews where people had the same problem. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: new all-in-one camera
Reviews.Author: J. Isaacson "Julie"
Reviews.Content: I love it.  It's easy to use and takes great pictures.  It's small enuf to take with me all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money, good zoom and lense
Reviews.Author: hippie kicker
Reviews.Content: this camera replaced an underwater olympus camera that was stolen. i very much like the zoom on this camera. it has 12x optical(lense)zoom and 48x overall(digital) zoom. the picture quality at 48x is very surprising, much better than i expected. good value at the 321 i paid for it, i dont think its worth much more than that if any at all. amazon could have shipped it a little better instead of just throwing the box in another box... but the camera works.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bob Schwartz
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera but it's easy to use so far.  I'm learning how and this camera makes it very easy.

Reviews.Title: Techage
Reviews.Author: Vinh Q. Tran "techage"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, Simple controls/menu, Nice features/settings, Bright LCD, excellent image quality, durablePro* Great picture* Great HD video (720P)* 12x zoom* Made in Japan* 28mmCons:HD video is recorded in .mov format; I have to convert them for my PS3

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Raftman "Sir Raftman"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera buy it here.  Found it for $229 at "Camera Giants"  super deal uh!  No way!  Ordered camera then was told to call for order verification. The Rep. then tried to sell me another battery because he claimed the original would only last 20 minutes! Battery cost $99.00.  Then he tried to sell me more memory cost $149.00.  When I explained that I own numerous Canon cameras and am well aware of what might be needed he quickly told me it would be a couple of weeks before they would ship the camera!  I called the next day to check on the status and was told it was back ordered and wasn't expected until late June!  I cancelled the order.You get what you pay for stay away from Camera Giants and stick with Amazon....

Reviews.Title: Too High Tech for its own good
